com.appscend.media

Class APSMediaPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.appscend.hub.KRHub
      • com.appscend.media.APSMediaPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    APSMediaEventStateListener, APSMediaEventTimeoutListener, VolumeChangedInterface

    public class APSMediaPlayer
extends KRHub
implements VolumeChangedInterface, APSMediaEventStateListener, APSMediaEventTimeoutListener
    The APSMediaPlayer handles playback and rendering of APSMediaUnits and APSMediaOverlays.

      static class  APSMediaPlayer.MPMoviePlaybackState

        public void init(Activity activity,
                 boolean statusBarVisible)
        Initialize the Veeplay SDK. This should be done as early as possible in the Activity lifecycle. Init should be always called when starting the application or if finish() was previously called and the player should be reused.
        Parameters:
        activity - the Activity the player is bound to
        statusBarVisible - whether the height of the OS status bar should be taken into account when layouting

        public void trackforEvent(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> urls,
                          java.lang.String event,
                          APSMediaTrackingEvents.MediaEventType type,

      • trackforEvent

        public void trackforEvent(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> urls,
                          java.lang.String event,
                          APSMediaTrackingEvents.MediaEventType type,
                          APSMediaEvent sourceEvent,
                          boolean emitEvent,
                          Bundle additionalInfo)
        Sends tracking information to one or more servers. All specified URLs will be requested via GET. See APSMediaTrackingEventsAPSMediaTrackingEvents for a list of supported event types.
        Parameters:
        urls - An array of String objects that should be pinged.
        event - A descriptive text of the events.
        type - The tracked event type. See APSMediaTrackingEvents.
        sourceEvent - The APSMediaUnit or APSMediaOverlay that triggered this event

      • openURL

        public boolean openURL(java.lang.String url)
        Instructs the player that a new URL needs to be interpreted and executed. This method will first ask the actionDelegate to respond to the given URL. If the actionDelegate declines to respond and the URL has a web scheme such as ('http:// or 'https://') then an in-app web browser window will be displayed modally.
        Parameters:
        url - The URL that needs to be loaded.

        public void performPostTapAction()

      • playableDuration

        public int playableDuration(int duration)
        Returns the current unit's video clip playable duration (the time interval that has already buffered and is ready for playback).
        Parameters:
        duration - - if the current video is shown through an overlay, this parameter will be multiplied by the result of the playableDuration method invoked on the overlay controller. Can be 0 in other cases;
        Returns:
        The video playable duration.

      • unitFinished

        public void unitFinished(APSMediaPlayer.MPMovieFinishReason reason)
        Handles the tear-down of the currently playing unit when it finishes (either because of unit completion, or because an error has occured or the unit is being skipped). Progress to the next unit is triggered automatically.
        Parameters:
        reason - the reason the unit is being teared down

      • volumeChanged

        public void volumeChanged(int volume)
        Detects changes in the current system audio volume and triggers any relevant VAST events.
        Specified by:
        volumeChanged in interface VolumeChangedInterface
        Parameters:
        volume - the current audio volume value

      • finish

        public void finish()
        Tears down all player resources, causing any currently playing units to stop and any tracking events to be issued. Once finish is called, the player should be re-initialized before further use.

      • next

        public void next()
        Proceeds to the next unit in the playlist and sends an exit event.

      • step

        public void step()
        Silently proceeds to the next unit in the playlist. Used in cases such as midroll adbreaks triggering.

        public void resetDisplayedOverlays()
        Repositions all currently displayed overlays

      • emitEvent

        public void emitEvent(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> urls,
                      java.lang.String event,
                      APSMediaTrackingEvents.MediaEventType type,
                      Bundle additionalInfo,
                      APSMediaEvent sourceEvent)
        Sends an APSMediaTrackingEvent to all registered listeners
        Parameters:
        urls - any associated tracking URLs
        event - the VAST string name of the event
        type - the APSMediaTrackingEvent.MediaEventType value for the event to notify
        additionalInfo - a collection of additional information to relay (for example the current playback time for a progress event)

      • onEventStateChanged

        public void onEventStateChanged(APSMediaEvent event,
                                APSMediaEvent.APSMediaEventState newEventState)
        A listener for the current state of the events in the current unit. Detects preloaded events and queues their triggering.
        Specified by:
        onEventStateChanged in interface APSMediaEventStateListener
        Parameters:
        event - the event that has changed state
        newEventState - the state the event has transitioned to

      • onEventTimeout

        public void onEventTimeout(APSMediaEvent event)
        A handler for APSMediaEvents that timeout during their preloading
        Specified by:
        onEventTimeout in interface APSMediaEventTimeoutListener
        Parameters:
        event - the event that has encountered the timeout

      • replaceCurrentUnitWithUnits

        public void replaceCurrentUnitWithUnits(java.util.ArrayList<APSMediaUnit> units)
        Replaces the currently playing APSMediaUnit with a collection of media units. Useful for unpacking the ad breaks inside of a MediaUnit into a series of playable APSMediaUnits.
        Parameters:
        units - an ArrayList of units to replace the current unit with.

      • insertMediaUnits

        public void insertMediaUnits(java.util.ArrayList<APSMediaUnit> mediaUnits)
        Inserts new media units after the current one, in the current playlist.
        Parameters:
        mediaUnits - An array of APSMediaUnit objects to be inserted into the playlist after the current unit.

      • setMediaUnits

        public void setMediaUnits(java.util.ArrayList<APSMediaEvent> mediaUnits)
        Sets new units to the playlist, clearing any old ones.
        Parameters:
        mediaUnits - An array of APSMediaUnit objects to create a new playlist.

      • addOverlays

        public void addOverlays(java.util.ArrayList<APSMediaOverlay> overlays)
        Enqueues a series of overlays to be triggered in the current media unit.
        Parameters:
        overlays - the overlays to be inserted into the queue

      • setSecureSurfaceView

        public void setSecureSurfaceView(boolean is_secure)
        Method for preventing the player SurfaceView from being captured in a screenshot or on unsecure screens. Defaults to true. This method should be called before calling init()
        Parameters:
        is_secure - use true in order to secure the SurfaceView

      • isSecureSurfaceView

        public boolean isSecureSurfaceView()
        Check if the surface view is secured from capture
        Returns:
        true if the surface view is running in protected mode

        Parameters:
